hanzi-su-wiki:
闘

Значения

Сражаться, бороться

Мнемоника

За воротами 門 бьют 寸 в набат 豆, зовут сражаться.

Варианты

鬪, 鬭, 斗, 鬥
purpleculture_pinyin:
dòu
Japanese variant of 斗
Японский вариант 斗
rtega_mnemonic:
闘闘RS鬦鬪鬭struggle, fight, compete, contend
  • throwing 寸 with beans 豆 to defend the entrance 門
heisig_constituent: fight, gates, beans, table, one, mouth, glue
koohiiStory1: During the saloon brawl, one guy got glued to a table and was tossed out through the saloon gates. But he really wanted to fight, so he ran back through those gates (with the table still glued to his back) only to be tossed out again. Imagine him repeatedly running in and being tossed back out.
koohiiStory2: Food fight! Look, beans are stuck to the gates like glue.
jp_example_words:
戦闘(せんとう): battle, fight, combat
奮闘(ふんとう): hard struggle, strenuous effort
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: At this gate you're trying to get some beans through, but the measurements were off and you're starting to struggle. No matter how you push or pull these beans, they're just too big to get through the gate.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: "I'm really struggling here, I thought you said you measured these beans?" you ask the bean seller. "I did! I mean, I struggled with the measurements, I'm not very good at math..." Ugh.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You continue to struggle because you need to get these beans to the other side of the gate and into とうきょう. You usually struggle a little when people want to bring things through the gate to とうきょう, but this is ridiculous.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: "How am I supposed to sell my beans if you struggle this much just to get them into とうきょう!" the bean seller shouts. It's making you struggle more, and beans start falling on your head, ripping their way out of their sack.
Ru_Radicals: 并, 口 (рот), 寸 (дюйм), 豆 (боб), 門 (ворота)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if the bean (豆) gets an inch (寸) through the gate (門) you'll fight it

闘字的基本解释

闘
dòu
古同“鬬”。

闘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dòu］
［《廣韻》都豆切，去候，端。］
亦作“1”。亦作“1”。“斗3”的繁体字。亦作“闘1”。亦作“鬦1”。亦作“鬪1”。亦作“鬭1”。亦作“1”。
(1)战斗；争斗。
(2)比赛；争胜。
(3)古时谓星辰相互撞击。
(4)纷乱。
(5)趁。
(6)面对；相对。
(7)相遇，遇合。
(8)拼合，凑。
(9)茶之精品。
(10)方言。禽鸟之巢。
(11)通“逗”。逗引；挑逗。
(12)通“兜”。招揽。参见“鬥買”。
(13)通“陡”。副词。突然。
(14)姓。春秋时楚有鬭伯比。见《广韵·去候》。

闘字的康熙字典解释

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Tian
dòu
The ancient same "south".
Tian
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dòu］
["Guangyun" cuts all beans, waits, and ends. ]
Also called "1". Also called "1". Traditional characters for "斗3". Also known as "闘1". Also known as "鬦1". Also known as "鬪1". Also known as "鬭1". Also called "1".
(1) Fight; fight.
(2) Competition; competition for victory.
(3) In ancient times, it was said that stars collided with each other.
(4) Chaos.
(5) Take advantage of it.
(6) Facing; relative.
(7) Encounter, meet together.
(8) Put together and make up.
(9) The fine products of tea.
(10) Dialects. Bird's nest.
(11) Through "come". Tease; tease.
(12) Through "pocket". Solicit. See "Buy in a bucket".
(13) Through "steep". adverb. suddenly.
(14) Last name. In the Spring and Autumn Period, there was Bobby Chu. See "Guangyun·Quhou".

Name meaning

dòu
яп. вм. 斗
Radicals: 門, 豆, 寸  (gate, beans, measurement)
Meaning Mnemonic
At this gate you're trying to get some beans through, but the measurements were off and you're starting to struggle. No matter how you push or pull these beans, they're just too big to get through the gate.
"I'm really struggling here, I thought you said you measured these beans?" you ask the bean seller. "I did! I mean, I struggled with the measurements, I'm not very good at math..." Ugh.
Reading Mnemonic
You continue to struggle because you need to get these beans to the other side of the gate and into とうきょう. You usually struggle a little when people want to bring things through the gate to とうきょう, but this is ridiculous.
"How am I supposed to sell my beans if you struggle this much just to get them into とうきょう!" the bean seller shouts. It's making you struggle more, and beans start falling on your head, ripping their way out of their sack.
